content:
Diagnosis:
Locally advanced pancreatic adenocarcinoma, T3N0M0
NTRK fusion positive

Previous treatment:
Whipple's procedure March 2024
Adjuvant FOLFIRINOX commenced April 2024

Current medications:
Entrectinib 600mg daily
Pancreatic enzyme replacement
Metformin for chemotherapy-induced diabetes

Current situation:
Cycle 3 of adjuvant FOLFIRINOX completed

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the pancreatic oncology clinic. She has completed cycle 3 of adjuvant FOLFIRINOX with good tolerance. Her main side effect has been grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only. Blood sugar control has improved on metformin. Performance status remains 0. CT scan performed last week shows no evidence of recurrent disease. Blood tests including CA19-9 are within normal range. The plan is to proceed with cycle 4 chemotherapy today and review again in three weeks.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows no evidence of recurrent disease

status_updates.value: Locally advanced pancreatic adenocarcinoma post Whipple's procedure, currently receiving adjuvant FOLFIRINOX with good tolerance
Grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only
